item.title: Building RNSSNC II: Basic frontend
item.description: This is supposed to be an RSS reader, so let’s add an RSS package. $ npm i rss-parser Upon requiring this in app.js, we get hit with a bunch of errors like this: ERROR in ./node_modules/xml2js/lib/parser.js 17:17-47 Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'timers' in '/home/sm/src/rnssnc/node_modules/xml2js/lib' BREAKING CHANGE: webpack < 5 used to include polyfills for node.js core modules by default. This is no longer the case. Verify if you need this module and configure a polyfill for it.

item.title: Building RNSSNC I: Boilerplate in 2022
item.description: This post functions as something of an update to the wonderful article Creating a React App From Scratch by the wonderful Jedai Saboteur, which hasn’t been updated since 2018. We’ll get React, Babel, and Webpack set up without having to wait for create-react-app to do its thing, dealing with a few issues that have cropped up over the years. Setup No changes need to be made to this section. First, we initialize the NPM manifest and the usual React directory structure.
